intro: Hablitzia tamnoides, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble bells, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist forest understories. The leaves are ovate and hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
